meanings.definition: Subfuscs: dark or dull in color
meanings.sent1: The old house had a subfuscs exterior that blended into the shadows.
meanings.sent2: The subfuscs clouds signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The subfuscs paint on the walls made the room feel gloomy.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was as subfuscs as the rainy sky outside.
meanings.sent5: The subfuscs rocks along the path made it hard to see in the dim light.

meanings.definition: Subfuscs: to make something dark or dull in color
meanings.sent1: She subfuscsed the bright painting by adding layers of black paint.
meanings.sent2: The rain subfuscsed the vibrant flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally subfuscsed his white shirt with a drop of ink.
meanings.sent4: The artist subfuscsed the canvas to create a somber atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The storm subfuscsed the clear sky, turning it a dull gray.
